main event: A large elliptical object was observed over the Hudson River in New York City on March 4, 1965.
interesting points: The object was about the size of a blimp, fluorescent bluish-white in color, and observed at an altitude over 10,000 feet.
The object was stationary and then departed very rapidly on a WNW heading over the horizon.
The weather conditions were clear with 5-8 mile visibility and light, variable winds.
The observer, described as a sober individual, was about 4 city blocks away from the object.
No discernible features, exhaust trails, or sound were observed.
